token.description: Discord token for your bot that you can find at https://discordapp.com/developers/applications

presence_type.description: Discord presence type from (playing, listening, watching) default: playing

presence.description: Discord presence message for the bot to display

discord_member_count_channel_id.description: Discord Channel ID to display a count of members in the discord

discord_member_count_format.description: Format for the discord member count, using {count} as a placeholder

user_channel_ids.description: Discord Channel ID or list of IDs that can use the user commands

cftools_application_id.description: ApplicationID provided by cftools at https://network.cftools.de/cfapi/overview

cftools_client_id.description: Client-ID provided by cftools at https://network.cftools.de/cfapi/overview

cftools_secret.description: Secret provided by cftools when creating the application

debug.description: Set the logging level to DEBUG for the locally running app. Equivalent to running with -v

command.description: Regex pattern that, if matched, will trigger the command

response.description: Discord embed object as described by https://discord.com/developers/docs/resources/channel#embed-object

ip.description: IP address of your DayZ server

rcon_port.description: RCon port for your DayZ server (may be different from the game port)

rcon_password.description: RCon password, found in the BattlEye profile directory in your server files

admin_channel_id.description: Discord Channel ID that can send admin RCon commands and where logs are sent

chat_channel_id.description: Discord Channel ID where the linked DayZ to Discord chat will take place

chat_ignore_regex.description: Pattern that, if matched, will not publish the message to the chat channel

chat_show_connect_disconnect_notices.description: Send connect and disconnect notices to chat channel

player_count_channel_id.description: Discord Channel ID where the linked DayZ to Discord chat will take place

player_count_format.description: Format for setting the channel name using {players}, {slots}, {queue}, and {time} as placeholders for the values

player_count_queue_format.description: Format that will be appended to the player count only if the queue is greater than 0

player_count_update_interval.description: Time, in seconds, between player count update queries

log_rcon_messages.description: Send all RCon messages to admin log channel

log_rcon_keep_alive.description: Send RCon keep alive status messages to admin log channel

cftools_service_id.description: Service ID cftools associates with the server

command.description: RCon command to run with parameters. Also accepts 'safe_shutdown'. See the template for examples

delay.description: Only used for 'safe_shutdown'. Specifies the delay in seconds before the shutdown

interval.description: Interval in seconds between runs of the command

offset.description: Delay in seconds from bot startup to running the command, or offset from midnight if with_clock is true
